# Steps to reproduce
I am trying non-interactive spn/certificate login by running a code below (on Linux environment):
```powershell
openssl req -newkey rsa:2048 -new -nodes -x509 -days 3650 -keyout /etc/ssl/private/key.pem -out /etc/ssl/private/cert.pem -subj "/C=LV/ST=Some-State/L=LV/O=IT/OU=IT"

# Get cert thumbprint
$keyValue = Get-Content /etc/ssl/private/cert.pem
$Thumbprint=[Convert]::ToBase64String([System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($keyValue))

# Connect to Azure
Import-Module Az.Resources
Connect-AzAccount

# Create SPN and add certificate
$ApplicationDisplayName = 'AuditSPN' + $(Get-Date -UFormat "%Y%m%d%S")
$ServicePrincipal = New-AzADServicePrincipal -DisplayName $ApplicationDisplayName
sleep 20s 
$ServicePrincipal | New-AzADSpCredential -CertValue $Thumbprint

# Get required parameters
$Tenant = Get-AzTenant
$ApplicationId = $ServicePrincipal.Id

Connect-AzAccount -CertificateThumbprint $Thumbprint -ApplicationId $ApplicationId -Tenant $Tenant.Id -ServicePrincipal

```

# Expected behavior

```none
I should be able to login to Azure
```

# Actual behavior

```none
I am getting "Connect-AzAccount : Unix LocalMachine X509Store is limited to the Root and CertificateAuthority stores." error.  

Full output - https://ibb.co/3SMtqy7
```
